algorithms.misc

Class MinMaxPeakFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.misc.MinMaxPeakFinder

  • public class MinMaxPeakFinder
extends java.lang.Object
    find peaks in sequential data by finding the minima above threshold and the maxima and then the maxima which are a gain factor above either adjacent minima. The success of the method depends upon a reasonable lowThreshold and gain. NOTE: methods such as those in MedianSmooth could be used to find a windowed mean and max (and hence, standard deviation, but they are dependent upon the size of the window. A peak that is a wide gradual plateau and a narrow window might miss the peak. first implemented in project https://github.com/nking/curvature-scale-space-corners-and-transformations w/ Copyright (c) 2014 Climb With Your Feet and using The MIT License (MIT) then moved to this shared library project which has the same copyright and license.
    Author:
    nichole

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float calculateMeanOfSmallest(float[] values, float fraction)
      copies and sorts values, then takes the fraction*values.length first indexes and calculates the mean for them and returns it.
      float calculateMeanOfSmallest(int[] values, float fraction)
      copies and sorts values, then takes the fraction*values.length first indexes and calculates the mean for them and returns it.
      int[] findMinimaMaxima(float[] values, float lowThreshold)
      find the minima above lowThreshold and the maxima in values and return their indexes.
      int[] findPeaks(float[] values)
      find the indexes of the array values which are local maxima whose values are above a calculated lowThreshold and a fixed factor 2.5 above one of the adjacent minima.
      int[] findPeaks(float[] values, float lowThreshold, float factorAboveMin)
      find the indexes of the array values which are local maxima whose values are above lowThreshold and a factor factorAboveMin above one of the adjacent minima.

      • findPeaks

        public int[] findPeaks(float[] values,
                       float lowThreshold,
                       float factorAboveMin)
        find the indexes of the array values which are local maxima whose values are above lowThreshold and a factor factorAboveMin above one of the adjacent minima.
        Parameters:
        values -
        lowThreshold -
        factorAboveMin -
        Returns:
        an array with indexes of peak values. if none were found an empty array is returned.

      • findMinimaMaxima

        public int[] findMinimaMaxima(float[] values,
                              float lowThreshold)
        find the minima above lowThreshold and the maxima in values and return their indexes. the negative values are -1*index for a minima while positive indexes are the indexes of maxima.
        Parameters:
        values -
        lowThreshold -
        Returns:
